discussion.content: File transfer (decrypts file) > Import already decrypted file > Wait until noon > Send Email > Wait 5 days > SQL to access data views with click & open activity > Data extract > Transfer file
A agreed

Selected Answer: B
Import File > File Transfer (decrypts file) > SQL Query (on accounts whose payment due date lapsed) > Wait (until noon) > Send Email > Wait (FOR 5 days) > SQL Query (to access data views with click & open activity) > Data Extract > File Transfer

comments.content: How can you import an encrypted file you fool lol
Please ignore this. A is correct answer

discussion.content: answer is definitely A
Should be A
It's A => File transfer to decrypt, then Import the file.
I think it should be A.

questions.question_text:
A financial company wants to use Marketing Cloud to send late payment notices to accounts whose payment due date lapsed the previous week. The company has shared the following:
✑ Payments.csv will arrive on the Enhanced SFTP each Monday at 1 a.m.
✑ Payments.csv will be encrypted.
✑ Payments.csv will contain data from the previous week.
✑ Late payment notices will be sent each Monday at noon.
✑ They need to receive a file containing customers who opened or clicked on the late payment notice email within five days after send.
Which automation sequence represents a viable solution?

choices.D: File Transfer > File Transfer > Import File > SQL Query > Wait > Send Email > SQL Query > File Transfer
choices.C: File Transfer > Import File > Filter > Wait > Send Email > SQL Query > Wait > Data Extract > File Transfer
choices.B: Import File > File Transfer > SQL Query > Wait > Send Email > Wait > SQL Query > Data Extract > File Transfer
choices.A: File Transfer > Import File > Filter > Wait > Send Email > Wait > SQL Query > Data Extract > File Transfer

choices.B: Links within emails will be wrapped with e.nto.com, and images within Content Builder will use e.nto.com.
choices.D: Links within emails will be wrapped with e.nto.com, but images within Content Builder will use mail.nto.com.
choices.C: Links within emails will be wrapped with mail.nto.com, but images within Content Builder will use e.nto.com.
choices.A: Links within emails will be wrapped with the same subdomain used for the From Address within the Sender Profile.

discussion.content:
Only 1 SAP can be used for branding (links and image wraps). Private domains to not apply to branding but do apply to from addresses. Answer A would have been true if only the 1 SAP domain existed. 

The correct answer should be "B" as Links and Images would be wrapped with the SAP (e.nto.com) domain and the Private Domain (mail.nto.com) would be used as from address for sending only.
B agreed
B is the better answer
A is correct because it keeps it simple: each email uses the sender profile with the specific domains. While B is correct on images; it is wrong on links (no longer mentions the split on domains).
Yes B is the correct answer
Both A and B are correct, but B is more precise in my opinione
I thinks the answer is B ( Links within emails will be wrapped with e.nto.com, and images within Content Builder will use e.nto.com. )
Only SAP domain includes link and image wrapping, not private domains. (B)

questions.question_text:
Northern Trail Outfitters (NTO) account will be used for email communications with its clients and employees. They want to send from two different subdomains, so they have delegated e.nto.com as their SAP domain and mail.nto.com as an additional Private Domain.
Which statement describes how this will impact the account?

The Campaign Email Tracking report shows send tracking data only for a specific campaign. And it does not include following metrics
* Overall Bounce Rate
* Block Bounce Rate
* Complaint Rate

Refer - https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=mc_re_campaign_email_tracking_report.htm&type=5&language=en_US

B is the correct answer. 

The Campaign Email Tracking report shows send tracking data only for a specific campaign. And it does not include following metrics
* Overall Bounce Rate
* Block Bounce Rate
* Complaint Rate

Refer - https://help.salesforce.com/s/articleView?id=mc_re_campaign_email_tracking_report.htm&type=5&language=en_US

the account send summary report do not contain individual campaign report, but rather a summary of all email send per BU.

questions.question_text:
Analyst of Northern Trail Outfitters (NTO) marketing team needs to pull email metrics for an upcoming quarterly company meeting. These metrics need to be reported per email campaign for each of NTO's Business Units:
* Number of Sends
* Delivery Rate
* Overall Bounce Rate
* Block Bounce Rate
* Open Rate
* Click Rate
* Complaint Rate
* Unsubscribe Rate
Which email report should NTO's Marketing Analyst pull from Marketing Cloud to get this information?

discussion.content: It cant be C because the customer wants to use Journey Builder and the click activity will be recorded after the first invitation email. therefore C is correct for engagement split and update contact activity.
isn't the option D, which can capture real-time click activity where the engagement split is not

questions.question_text:
A pharmaceutical company is hosting a monthly event and will be sending an invitation to new local contacts. The customer would like to automatically update a data extension to determine who will be attending.
✑ The data extension will hold each contact's response as well as the time stamp of the click.
✑ The contact will receive an email two days after the click event.
✑ Both emails should be sent via Journey Builder.
What is the optimal solution to record the click activity prior to sending the second email?

choices.B: Use a landing page to record the click and trigger an email.
choices.C: Leverage the Engagement Split and the Update Contact Activity.
choices.A: Leverage the Decision Split and create a Custom Activity.
choices.D: Use a landing page to record the click in the data extension.

choices.B: Each attribute group can contain multiple lists, and each list can include multiple attributes.
choices.C: Data extensions can be linked to either the contact record or different data extensions, including data extensions from other attribute groups.
choices.D: Each attribute group can contain multiple data extensions, and each data extension can include multiple attributes.
choices.A: Each attribute group contains one data extension, and each data extension can include up to 50 attributes.
choices.E: Data extensions should be linked directly to the contact record prior to being linked to different data extensions.
